item.title: The South Korean court has ordered Wemade to compensate a former employee approximately $7.14 million in arrears.
item.description: August 22nd. As per Nwes1, the Seoul Central District Court has issued a partial ruling in favor of the plaintiffs in a compensation lawsuit that current and former employees had brought against Wemade. The court has determined that Wemade is required to compensate them a combined total of 99.3928 billion Korean won (approximately $7.14 million).In July of the previous year, 27 current and former executives and employees of Wemade filed a lawsuit against the company, seeking 161.7648 billion Korean won in compensation. Those who had been working at Wemade's subsidiary, Wemade Tree, claimed that the company had promised to make payments but had failed to do so, thus leading to the filing of the lawsuit.

item.title: Fed's Collins: Current US Economic Inflation Faces Upside Risk, Labor Faces Downside Risk
item.description: August 22: Federal Reserve official Collins noted that the current US economic inflation is exposed to upside risks, while the labor market is facing downside risks. We cannot afford to wait for all uncertainties to subside (in order to discuss interest rate adjustments).

item.title: The Trinity Dispute Resolution Plan (DvP) for Security Tokens Based on Stablecoins Launched to Facilitate Cross-Chain Settlement between Japanese Stablecoin and Security Token.
item.description: August 22nd. TOKI is participating in this project as a technical partner. item.title: Huaxin Capital Partners with YZi Labs to Invest Approximately $100 Million in Strategic Allocation of BNB Assets
item.description: On August 22nd, according to an announcement from the Hong Kong Stock Exchange, Huaxing Capital has announced a strategic cooperation memorandum with YZi Labs. The purpose is to support applications in the BNB and BNB Chain ecosystems and establish a mutually beneficial partnership. The cooperation includes the following aspects:Huaxing Capital's leading strategic BNB special allocation: The company will invest approximately $100 million in a special allocation of BNB assets, aiming to become the first Hong Kong-listed company to include BNB in a special digital asset allocation.Promotion of Web3 ecosystem-related initiatives and facilitation of BNB's listing on compliant exchanges.Establishment of a Real World Asset (RWA) Fund and promotion of BNB Chain ecosystem projects.

item.title: Market Betting Powell to Stay Hawkish on Rate Cuts
item.description: August 22nd. The data of currency options indicates that the bullish sentiment towards the US dollar has reached the highest level in three weeks. Traders are betting that Powell will not adopt an overly dovish stance on interest rate cuts. "The possibility of a 25-basis-point rate cut in September will be maintained," said Sonja Martens, the director of FX and currency policy research at Deutsche Bank. "But I don't think he will be more aggressive than that."Martens suggested that Powell may resist the pressure from Trump for rate cuts and will "very clearly show that he will not take a path that may lack fundamental support due to the pressure from the White House." Nick Rees, the head of macro research at Monex Europe, said that if the market "overreacts" to any hints from Powell about a possible rate cut in September, it may trigger the initial selling of the US dollar. item.title: Analysis: Mixed Feelings Economic Data May Force Powell to Strike a Balance in Tonight's Speech
item.description: August 22: Federal Reserve Chairman Powell is scheduled to deliver a speech at the Jackson Hole Annual Economic Symposium at 10 p.m. Beijing time on Friday. Currently, the Fed is encountering unprecedented political pressure from the United States. However, the mixed economic data may compel Powell to adopt a moderate stance, leaving key issues unresolved.Regarding the interest rate policy, some analysts anticipate a middle-of-the-road approach. Powell may potentially leave the door open for a rate cut in September to recognize the necessity for further easing due to weak job growth. Nevertheless, he will not make more definite commitments until policymakers are more certain that the rising inflation is temporary. This stance may not satisfy Trump, who advocates for a significant cut in rates to around 1%, nor investors who are betting on multiple rate cuts this year. item.title: SharpLink's Board of Directors Approves $1.5 Billion Stock Repurchase Plan
item.description: On August 22nd, as per an official announcement, the Ethereum treasury firm SharpLink disclosed that its board of directors had given the green light to a stock buyback plan, with a maximum buyback amount of $1.5 billion for the company's common stock.SharpLink's Co-CEO Joseph Chalom stated, "At SharpLink, we are consistently committed to a rigorous capital market strategy. In the event that our stock's trading price reaches or drops below the net asset value ('NAV') of the ETH we hold, issuing new shares through financing would lead to a dilution of the per-share ETH equity. In such a situation, a value-enhancing approach could be to repurchase our common stock. This plan enables us to flexibly respond to these circumstances and take prompt and decisive action."The stock buyback plan is designed to enhance market support, optimize capital allocation, and strengthen SharpLink's long-term dedication to driving sustainable shareholder value.
